pullRequest.body:
This PR provides two lemmas:

- `Matrix.rank_mul_eq_left_of_isUnit_det` in a commutative ring R post multiplication (multiplication from the right) by an invertible matrix does not change the rank of a matrix. With $A$ an invertible matrix:
$$\text{rank}(BA) = \text{rank}(B)$$

- `Matrix.rank_mul_eq_right_of_isUnit_det` in a commutative ring R pre-multiplication (multiplication from the left) by an invertible matrix does not change the rank of a matrix. With $A$ an invertible matrix:
$$\text{rank}(AB) = \text{rank}(B)$$

Co-authored-by: Mohanad Ahmed <m.a.m.elhassan@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5755572575/job/15603294821)

```suggestion
```
Move to previous line; space between `]` and `[`
indent 4 spaces not 2; space between `)` and `(`; space between `)` and `:`
indent 4 lines not 2; `B ⬝ A` not `B⬝A`.
add to previous line
I am depending on the `rfl` implicit in rw on line 288. I cannot merge the following rewrite because then there will be no `rfl` for the `rank B = rank B` goal.
I can add a comment to clarify that if it helps?
`intro` if only one variable
use `rwa` not `rw` and you won't need `exact hA` on next line
spaces and indentation here and on next two lines
spaces in `A⬝B`
this can surely be more succinct.
This is another implicit `rfl`
But you have 5 `*rw` lines; are there 4 implicit rfls?

1. The first `rw [← LinearMap.finrank_range_add_finrank_ker ((A⬝B).mulVecLin), h, add_left_inj] at hB` is a rewrite at hB
2. The second `rw [Matrix.rank, Matrix.rank, hB]` is a rewrite using hB and has an implicit rfl.
3. The third `rw [mulVecLin_mul, LinearMap.ker_comp_of_ker_eq_bot]` has an implicit rfl
4. The fourth is a rewrite with no implicit rfl and I have merged into the simp_rw beneath it. This is now in the latest commit
5. The simp_rw is necessary because it works under the binder and there are repititions
I think maybe there's a helper lemma hiding here then? I can look more tomorrow.
Does `simpa [mulVec_mulVec, nonsing_inv_mul A hA, one_mulVec] using h` work?
Yes it works
You should use `Type _` where possible so that your lemmas are applicable for types in higher universes
are there matrices in higher universes?

In principle yes, in practice not so much I don't think. Neverthess it's good style to be flexible just in case. Especially for a theoretical result like these, that could be useful in a more general context. Types in higher universes certainly do occur in mathlib
At any rate, there should be existing variables at the top of the file that you can just re-use
Ok I removed the variables in the declarations and reused the ones from the top of the file. I added the DecidableEq instances since these are needed for the definition of determinant.
I think the tactic `apply_fun` might be useful here, as `apply_fun Matrix.mulVec (A⁻¹) at h` (also I'm not sure if the brackets are needed.)

Maybe
```suggestion
lemma rank_mul_eq_right_of_isUnit {m n R: Type} [Fintype m] [Fintype n] [DecidableEq m] [Field R]
```
to match `rank_mul_le_right`?

I don't think that is a good name.  I guess what I consider a better name is something like [`Matrix.rank_conjTranspose`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Matrix/Rank.html#Matrix.rank_conjTranspose) or [`Matrix.rank_self_mul_conjTranspose`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Matrix/Rank.html#Matrix.rank_self_mul_conjTranspose).

Both names describe the LHS and probably rely on you implicitly knowing the RHS (I am guessing here).  The name `rank_mul_eq_right_of_isUnit` in additon to being longer, places right and the word isUnit both to the RHS of eq which obscures it even more.

> places [...] the word isUnit [...] to the RHS of eq

This is by design; according to the naming convention, a lemma that concludes `C` from `H` should be called `$(name C)_of_$(name H)` (or just `name C` if `H` is obviously an assumption)

Neither of the examples you give has such a hypothesis.

But the conclusion here is something of nature rank_...._eq_rank. Maybe
`rank_mul_isUnit_eq_rank
The conclusion here would be called `rank_mul_eq_right`. `IsUnit` is not part of the conclusion, it's part of the hypothesis: so it belongs after an `_of_`.

```suggestion
    (A : Matrix n n R) (B : Matrix m n R) (hA : IsUnit A.det) :
```
and below.
I've unresolved this as it still applies
I've unresolved this as it still applies
It seems I didn't fetch the changes in my local copy and when I merged last they where undone

```suggestion
  rw [Matrix.rank, mulVecLin_mul, LinearMap.range_comp_of_range_eq_top, ←Matrix.rank]
```

```suggestion
/-- Pre (left) multiplying by an invertible matrix does not change the rank -/
```
I'd just drop usage of "pre" and "post", which aren't particularly helpful compared to left and right.

```suggestion
  · rw [LinearMap.range_eq_top] 
    intro x
    use ((A⁻¹).mulVecLin x)
    rwa [mulVecLin_apply, mulVecLin_apply, mulVec_mulVec, mul_nonsing_inv, one_mulVec]
```
The comment as is is rather confusing (I didn't understand it until opening this in VSCode). The point is that the previous rewrite closed the goal, and you are now working on a side goal. This suggestion is perhaps clearer, but a comment explicitly mentioning that the rest of the proof is the side goal generated by `range_comp_of_range_eq_top` would be better.

Or even better --- prove the side goal *first*, in a `have`!
Please use `· ` and indenting to delimit the two separate goals after the suffices.

Usually we only indent the first goal after `suffices`
```suggestion
  rw [mulVecLin_mul, LinearMap.ker_comp_of_ker_eq_bot]
  simp_rw [LinearMap.ker_eq_bot, Function.Injective, mulVecLin_apply]
  intros x y h
  apply_fun Matrix.mulVec (A⁻¹) at h
  simpa [mulVec_mulVec, nonsing_inv_mul A hA, one_mulVec] using h
```

I understood @semorrison comment
"Please use · and indenting to delimit the two separate goals after the suffices." to mean both goals must be indented. Was that a misunderstanding?
I'll let @semorrison decide.

```suggestion
lemma rank_mul_eq_left_of_isUnit_det [DecidableEq n] [CommRing R]
```
and below

```suggestion
lemma rank_mul_eq_right_of_isUnit_det [DecidableEq m] [CommRing R]
```

No action needed; but the lemma above is called `of_is_unit` and takes `IsUnit A` instead of `IsUnit A.det`.
Deciding between these is probably a job for wider cleanup.

@ocfnash, what do you think of this proof?
```lean
/-- Left multiplying by an invertible matrix does not change the rank -/
lemma rank_mul_eq_right_of_isUnit_det [DecidableEq m] [StrongRankCondition R]
    (A : Matrix m m R) (B : Matrix m n R) (hA : IsUnit A.det) :
    (A ⬝ B).rank = B.rank := by
  refine le_antisymm (rank_mul_le_right _ _) ?_
  conv_lhs => rw [←Matrix.nonsing_inv_mul_cancel_left A B hA]
  exact (rank_mul_le_right _ _)
```
I'm puzzled why I need `StrongRankCondition R` but you don't; is `rank_mul_le_right` true more generally too?

I'm currently traveling (and also meant to be preparing a talk for the morning) so I only have a moment but following instance may answer your questions:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/FreeModule/StrongRankCondition.html#commRing_strongRankCondition

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: (Mathlib.Data.Matrix.Rank): rank of a matrix unaffected by multiplication with invertible matrices
